paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

patients.demographics: varied, specific ages and ethnicities not detailed
patients.phenotype: length-dependent small fiber sensorimotor polyneuropathy with loss of pain and temperature; heart failure; arrhythmia; nephrotic disease

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P1 presented with length-dependent small fiber sensorimotor polyneuropathy at age 30.
Patient P2 was diagnosed with heart failure and arrhythmia at age 40.
Patient P3, although a carrier, remained asymptomatic at age 50.

functional_data.summary: The Val40Met mutation in TTR is associated with amyloid fibril formation leading to neuropathy.
assays: in vitro amyloid fibril formation assays

variants.segregation_data: Yes, segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The penetrance of TTR variants is incomplete, with some carriers remaining unaffected.
key_quotes: The penetrance of ATTRv is incomplete in carriers.
Val30Met is the most common ATTRv mutation worldwide.

tables_processed.table_caption: Classification of autonomic neuropathies: etiology, clinical presentation, testing, and treatment

extraction_metadata.notes: Data was extracted thoroughly from the main text and tables.
